DataElement.preferredName: Disease Response Granulocyte Hyperplasia Assessment Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response regarding the state of pathologic and/or clinical changes to the number of granulocyte in an organ resulting in enlargement as a result of treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._A leucocyte with conspicuous cytoplasmic granules. In humans the granulocytes are also classified as polymorphonuclear leucocytes and are subdivided according to the staining properties of the granules into eosinophils, basophils and neutrophils._An abnormal increase in the number of cells in an organ or a tissue with consequent enlargement._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: In medicine, an improvement related to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Property.preferredDefinition: A leucocyte with conspicuous cytoplasmic granules. In humans the granulocytes are also classified as polymorphonuclear leucocytes and are subdivided according to the staining properties of the granules into eosinophils, basophils and neutrophils.:An abnormal increase in the number of cells in an organ or a tissue with consequent enlargement.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A type of leukocyte with a multilobed nucleus and cytoplasmic granules. The unique morphology of the nucleus has led to their also being known as polymorphonuclear leukocytes (PMLs or PMNs). Granulocytes are subdivided according to the staining properties of their granules into eosinophils (red with acidic dye), basophils (blue with basic dye), and neutrophils (not amenable to staining with either acidic or basic dyes).
An abnormal increase in the number of cells in an organ or a tissue with consequent enlargement.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.: The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
